Name: buttermilk, from cow milk to generic market for protein feed | protein feed, 100% crude | EN15804GD, U
Category: C:Manufacturing/10:Manufacture of food products/108:Manufacture of prepared animal feeds/1080:Manufacture of prepared animal feeds
Description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/12111/documentation

This activity is a linking activity, i.e. it connects buttermilk with generic protein feed market. Buttermilk is produced as a by-product in butter production. Buttermilk can be used either for direct human consumption or as a feed for animals. This activity supply part of the buttermilk to the generic market for protain feed, where it is traded with other protein - containing products.

Buttermilk is a by-product from butter production. This linking activity has the buttermilk as an input and protein and energy feed as output.
